name: The Ritz-Carlton, Buckhead

reviews.text: I love that this property has more of a traditional old Ritz feel to it. Wood all over the lobby bar, plush furniture. I only stayed for a night, the property was pretty full so I got stuck with a room on a low floor but the room itself was nice.
reviews.title: A good hotel but downtown is a better value

reviews.text: The service was ok, nothing spectacular. The bartender, Chris, was great though. He made up for the bar itself being too small for a hotel that size.
reviews.title: Top of the line hotel with exceptional staff that goes above and beyond.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ritz is still getting used to having a loyalty program and people with status. I had to argue to get a late check-out once again. But overall I was happy.
reviews.title: Excellent well run hotel
Ok Business Hotel- Great Chocolate Chip Cookies
reviews.text: I was responsible for putting on a conference at this hotel and the staff were very responsive, helpful and attentive to our needs. The rooms, banquet and meeting space, pool and fitness center, gift shop and lobby were all superb, but in my opinion it is the staff and the why they present themselves that really make a trip enjoyable and make you feel comfortable. The Ritz Carlton Buckhead delivered.

We moved from The Ritz Carlton downtown for a change and to be the shops...well my partner did! The hotel is right in the middle of shop heaven. It is a truly well run smooth top end hotel. We found the surrounding area a bit barren and sterile unless you had a car, which we did not then, then a lot is closed to you. There are some good restaurants near enough to the hotel within walking distance. The rooms are...as expected with the Ritz C...large, comfortable and spotless and well equiped. Special mention to the lovely lady in the lobby, from Eastern Europe, who could not have been more helpful and nice to us. She is a true asset to this hotel. Overall I liked here but, sorry!, I have to confess a preference for the downtown one!
reviews.title: Wow! Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were in Atlanta for the night and stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Buckhead. She chose the hotel for its pool, which indeed was nice, but we encountered too many issues to be interested in returning.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to our expectations of a Ritz property

reviews.text: In no particular order, issues we noted included:
reviews.title: So outstanding that we forgot that we were not at home!

reviews.text: 1. The valet offered us a choice of $32/night valet parketing vs. $17/night self-parking but failed to inform us of the important nuance that self-parking did not include in-and-out privileges.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel adjacent to best shopping in SE USA

reviews.text: 2. At night, the hotel's side entrance by the self-park lot is locked, with no hotel key card access.
reviews.title: Feels like coming home.

reviews.text: 3. The bedspread in the room was mildly stained.
reviews.title: Perfection !!!

reviews.text: I returned recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton Buckhead after a hiatus of ten years. I was once a frequent business traveler to Atlanta, and the hotel was my oasis. Buckhead has grown and prosperous, but I'm delighted to report that the Ritz Carlton has retained its low-key beauty and grace -- and superior service --- in intervening years. Lovely room, fast-valet parking and very helpful staff. Still one of my all-time favorite hotels.
reviews.title: Still the Best Hotel in Buckhead

reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton-Buckhead is a perfect example of Ritz Carlton quality and consistency. Class is the best way to describe the style and staff at this property. The rooms are well appointed and the meeting space is comfortable and professional. The bar/lounge area is a great meeting location. Sunday Brunch is worth the stay alone. Finally lets not forget the old real estate adage 'Location, Location, Location'. Buckhead is the home of great restaurants, bars and shopping.
reviews.title: Ritz Carlton Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in several Ritz hotels over the years and I have never received the high level of customer service that I received from the staff at Buckhead Ritz Carlton. The employees here are top notch. I was stunned when the bell hop offered to open the hotel store outside of normal operating hours when we needed something! The hotel has complimentary town car service within a 2 mile radius, but we didn't use it since we opted to walk to the Marta stop while at the Ritz. The Marta stop is about a block and a half from the hotel and is a very easy walk. The shopping mall directly across the street from the hotel was also very convenient. I am afraid that this hotel has spoiled me and given me exaggerated expectations of what good customer service can be. I will definitely stay here when I return to Atlanta! I wish the Ritz hotels would start providing free Wi-Fi though.
reviews.title: They have the best customer service from a Ritz Carlton ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights on the club level and I can't think of one thing they could improve. The employees on the 18th floor are the best I've encountered anywhere. The food and drink choices were fresh and plentiful and their advice/guidance for sightseeing, directions, etc. was right on. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A truly wonderful experience!

reviews.text: Very elegant. Outstanding service. Very clean. Rooms are nice size. Concierge floor is excellent. Highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Elegant retreat in Buckhead

reviews.text: Love, love, love this hotel. The location is great for shopping and getting around Atlanta. The property itself is older but is well taken care of and updated. Service is what you'd expect form Ritz-Carlton and I wish I was staying longer.
reviews.title: Perfecto!

reviews.text: I believe my outlook on my experience here is shadowed by the fact that I was pregnant, in the dead heat of summer. I could NOT get cool in our room, it never got below 72. Finally, I requested a fan, and they took the one from the break room for me to use. I was very impressed with that. The lobby seemed small, and it took a while to get checked-in (by Ritz standards.) The drinks in the room were not cold, and the bathroom was very small. I found that the bathrooms at the Intercontinental were more spacious, and let's face it, the Intercontinental can be a lot less than the Ritz. This one is located in the heart of Buckhead, very easy to get in and out of, considering it's location. I would stay here again, but I prefer the Ritz in Midtown over this one. In Midtown, we were greeted like royalty, our car was cleaned out (all trash, etc. removed), doors were opened for us, etc. It was a good experience, and everything was very clean, but it was not a GREAT experience. I was hot the whole time until I got the fan, and I was dying for a cold drink, which I could never find one. However, the iced tea in the lobby was a welcomed treat after being stuck in traffic at the 285 split. We did have roomservice for breakfast, and it was delicious, as always!
reviews.title: Good not GREAT

description: Surround yourself with an irresistible combination of Southern hospitality and relevant sophistication at The Ritz-Carlton, Buckhead, GA, hotel. Ideally situated in the heart of Atlanta’s most celebrated neighborhood, The Ritz-Carlton, Buckhead offers guests effortless access to the city’s finest shopping, dining and entertainment.
